text:
Hi everyone

I'm trying to take some of our marketplace templates and convert them into a theme, learning the theme limitations as I go.

Is it possible to add CSS classes like you were able to previously using the Design Manager? Attached two screenshots to explain what I am attempting, the second is in my theme code and doesn't output the HTML, but I can't find any other way in the docs to accomplish this.

You need to add the extra_classes parameter directly to the module code rather than before it.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#parameters-available-for-all-modules>
<@U010F27NS6L> Perfect! Thanks. Struggle to find the right docs sometimes.
Absolutely. and I agree! I’ve been digging through them a lot lately and just happened to remember that one since I had to use it myself! :slightly_smiling_face:
Also to clear some things up.  Themes support everything you were able to do before, just minus drag and drop templates basically.

<@U7SL518D6> i see a reference to “tab”: “CONTENT” here
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#repeating-fields>
and i see that there’s also a STYLE tab from getting an error in the watch.

but i can’t find any further documentation. can i switch on the style tab in a custom module and separate style from content/options? or is that deprecated?
if there is documentation can you point me toward it….
There is no documentation on it. At this time it is not possible to provide style tab fields.
damn. count me in for an upvote if y’all discuss it
i’m all for separation of powers
so what is that tab thing?
